required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MAGE of Anagliptin Compared With Sitagliptin With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Active Controlled, Randomized, Double-blinded, Parallel, Phase IV Study to Evaluate the Effect of Improving Glycemic Variability of Anagliptin Compared With Sitagliptin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: An exploratory study to evaluate the Effect of Improving Glycemic Variability of Anagliptin Compared with Sitagliptin in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

detailed_description.textblock: This clinical trial is an exploratory study, and does not calculate the subject number based on statistical assumptions, and enrolls 50 subjects per group and a total of 100 subjects are registered to evaluate the effect of improving blood glucose variability in type 2 patients with anagliptin 100 mg twice a day(BID) and sitagliptin 100 mg once a day(QD).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A Multi-center, Active controlled, Randomized, Double-blinded, Parallel Study

secondary_outcome.measure: Average nighttime (18:00~07:59) blood glucose change after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: after 12 weeks compared to baseline in the test group and the control group

intervention.description: Continuous Glucose Monitoring with Anagliptin 100mg BID or Sitagliptin 100mg QD treatment for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 DM
- Metformin monotherapy for more than 8 weeks and metformin ≥ 1000 mg daily for more than 8 weeks.
- 6.5% ≤HbA1c< 8.5%
- Agreed Therapeutic Lifestyle change during the study period
- Obtained Informed Consent Form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus,
- History of intestinal obstruction
- NYHA class III to IV congestive heart failure,
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) > 3 X upper limit of normal (ULN) or Total bilirubin > 3 X ULN
- Creatinine clearance (CrCl)* < 50 mL/min
- Thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) ≥ 1.5 X ULN
- Allergic history for Anagliptin 또는 sitagliptin
- Being pregnant or nursing or suspected of being pregnant, or
- History of participation in other clinical studies in the preceding 3 months.
